sentences.sContent: He had a laceration on his head.
sentences.sContent_eng: He had a laceration on his head.

sentences.sContent: First, the medical term for a cut or tear in the skin is a laceration.
sentences.sContent_eng: First, the medical term for a cut or tear in the skin is a laceration.
sentences.sCn: 首先，这种皮肤的切口或裂口在医学上称为撕裂伤。

sentences.sContent: I often think of the Tiny Love Wind Chime Recall in which baby wind chime toys came apart and caused a puncture and laceration hazard.
sentences.sContent_eng: I often think of the Tiny Love Wind Chime Recall in which baby wind chime toys came apart and caused a puncture and laceration hazard.
sentences.sCn: 我经常想起小小爱风铃召回事件。 在这起事件里，婴儿风铃破碎，并造成了被刺到、被割到的伤害。

words.tran: 撕裂（lacerate的过去式和过去分词）；划破
